intro: Mappia racemosa var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mappia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, this plant thrives in humid, well-drained soils. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
